etymologies: early 17th century (in the sense ‘specter’): from Latin, literally ‘image, apparition’, from specere ‘to look’

definitions: a band of colors, as seen in a rainbow, produced by separation of the components of light by their different degrees of refraction according to wavelength.
shortDefinitions: band of colours, as seen in rainbow, produced by separation of components of light

definitions: the entire range of wavelengths of electromagnetic radiation.
shortDefinitions: entire range of wavelengths of electromagnetic radiation

definitions: an image or distribution of components of any electromagnetic radiation arranged in a progressive series according to wavelength.
shortDefinitions: characteristic series of frequencies of electromagnetic radiation

definitions: an image or distribution of components of sound, particles, etc., arranged according to such characteristics as frequency, charge, and energy.
shortDefinitions: components of sound or other phenomenon arranged according to such characteristics

definitions: used to classify something, or suggest that it can be classified, in terms of its position on a scale between two extreme or opposite points

examples.text: the left or the right of the political spectrum

shortDefinitions: used to classify something in terms of its position on scale between two extreme points

examples.text: self-help books are covering a broader and broader spectrum
